comment: As the others said, Lahey is amazing but his classes require the utmost effort. But if you aren't willing to put in your best effort for these classes, you may as well change majors/fields now and save yourself the time and pain. The UI/UX industry is ROUGH and if you can't handle his class, you won't make it in the real job world.

Dr. Lahey was, has been, and will always be my favorite professor. If you are an IAD major, then he is your life line. He genuinely cares about students and is very passionate about what he teaches. He is extremely supportive. His class is tough, but if you try hard and care about the course, you will do just fine. Guidance and coaching always.
Lahey is awesome. Lahey is cool. Lahey is the best. period.

Lahey is an amazing professor! He truly cares about his students and is a hilarious guy. However, you HAVE to put in the work as he is not kidding around when it comes to the content. He is a particular grader and there is a major group project during the semester. I left with an A but I worked really hard.

Lahey is by far the greatest teacher I have ever had, and most likely will have. If you are a programmer, UXer, or anything related, youd be out of your mind to not have this guys class at least once. Seriously, great. Im a full stack web developer taking him fall 17, and my only regret is Ill have to wait till fall 18 to take his class again
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: One of the best professors at KSU. He's very funny, realistic, and offered a sense of what the 'real world' is like outside of college. One of the few professors that gave constructive criticism on creative projects, which was a welcome break. Class with him always felt refreshing, down to earth, and fun. High standards, but take him if you can!
He is totally reasonable and just wants you to produce a higher standard of work for your own benefit. He makes his content fun too. I wish I had more courses with him.

Your grade will come from 3 presentations throughout the semester. Grades on both your presentation skills in addition to the content of your presentations. Practice your speeches and make sure they're on point. If you hate public speaking or aren't good at giving presentations, you'll struggle for a C. I pulled a B in his class, but it was hell!!

Only 3 exams and a final project, and we had to read one book for each exam. Lahey is funny at times and tries to keep class engaging. His exams were anywhere from 2-4 essay questions. Very harsh, tough grader. If you don't format your writing correctly, miss major points or even miss a single detail, you will miss a huge chunk of points. Made a C.

Mr. Lahey is a very laid-back professor who is very passionate about what he teaches. His lectures go along with very clean and easy to follow powerpoints. His quizzes for this class were over films and readings that were assigned and contained some tricky questions that could throw you off if you didn't pay good attention. I am taking him again.

While my easiness rating is a 2 I want to emphasize that Professor Lahey is an incredibly fair person but you absolutely have to put the work in. And really, he is thinking in the students best interests, always. The class I took this time around was 5 weeks long and he put in the work to make sure it adapted efficiently to the time constraints.

There's a good bit of reading material but he's very conscious about giving too much. He wants you to try and really think critically. He's very funny and very nice, definitely one of the best teachers I've had. Very helpful but brutally honest (in a good way), listens to opinions. Knows his stuff and makes you feel like you do too after a lecture.

Take him, you will not regret it!!  Half of his tests are recalling images he gives you to study, give the name of paintor and name of painting. Theres about 40 of them.  the other half is mc.  He curses sometimes (not at students but just randomly lol) keeps the class entertaining.  but yea take him.

Great professor!  His lectures are very interactive and he makes you feel comfortable with giving your input.  There are 3 short essays and 1 major MLA style paper assigned which are all very easy to get an A on.  Overall, it was a great experience and he offers extra credit!  I highly recommend him!
